venues.name: As a result of the Covid-19 emergency, and the Governor’s Executive Orders N-29-20-and N-33-20, this Coastal Commission meeting will occur virtually through video and teleconference. The Coastal Commission is conducting the meeting virtually to avoid a public gathering and protect public health during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title.spanish: Commission Meeting
LLAMADO A ORDEN y VOTO NOMINAL
PROCEDIMIENTOS DE ASAMBLEA VIRTUAL
CAMBIOS EN LA AGENDA
COMENTARIO PÚBLICO GENERAL

blurb.english: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.
blurb.spanish: Los comentarios públicos que no están relacionados con ninguno de los ítems específicamente incluidos en el orden del día serán oídos aproximadamente a las 9:00am, por no más de una hora. A discreción del Chair, se les dará a las personas que hablen hasta 2 minutos. Debido a la transición de Plataforma de asamblea virtual, la Comisión Costera en este momento no permitirá que se ceda tiempo de una persona que hable a otra. Nota: Durante el comentario del público general, usted puede hablar sobre un tema específico solamente una vez cada mes. Por favor, envíe su solicitud de orador antes de las 5:00 pm del día anterior a la audiencia para ayudar con la inscripción de la administración de reuniones. Las solicitudes de orador no se aceptarán después de las 8:30 am de cada día de la reunión. Sírvase consultar el memorandum de la Comisión Costera sobre procedimientos para la asamblea virtual para enviar una solicitud para hablar.

title.english: City of Huntington Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-HNB-19-0011-1. (Omnibus Clean-up Non-Medical Marijuana Wireless Facilities).
title.spanish: Enmienda LCP No. LCP-5-HNB-19-0011-1 de la Ciudad de Huntington Beach. (Omnibus Clean-up Non-Medical Marijuana Wireless Facilities)

blurb.english: Public hearing and action on request by City of Huntington Beach to amend  Implementation Plan (IP) of certified LCP to: 1) change name of Dept. and Director of Planning & Building to Community Development Dept.; 2) prohibit non-medical marijuana businesses and deliveries and regulate non-medical marijuana cultivation; 3) revise Section 230.96 (Wireless Communication Facilities); 4) remove references to  State Government Code in six locations in the IP; and, 5) establish conditional use permit process to permit ancillary on-site sale, service and consumption of alcohol at specific sites in  Open Space-Parks & Recreation zoning district; Huntington Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)
blurb.spanish: Audiencia pública y acción a petición de la Ciudad de Huntington Beach para enmendar el Plan de Implementación (IP) del LCP certificado para: 1) cambiar el nombre del Departamento y del Director de Planeación y Construcción al Departamento de Desarrollo Comunitario; 2) prohibir la comercialización y entrega de marihuana no medicinal y regular el cultivo de marihuana no medicinal; 3) revisar la Sección 230.96 (Instalaciones de Comunicación Inalámbrica); 4) retirar las referencias al Código del Gobierno Estatal en seis lugares en el IP; y, 5) establecer un proceso de permiso de uso condicional para permitir la venta, servicio y consumo auxiliar de alcohol en lugares específicos en el distrito de zonificación de Parques con Espacio Abierto y Recreación en Huntington Beach, Condado de Orange. (MV-LB)

title.spanish: Enmienda LCP No. LCP-5-HNB-20-0089-2 de la Ciudad de Huntington Beach. (Omnibus Clean-up and Group Homes)

blurb.english: Public hearing and action on request by City of Huntington Beach to amend  Implementation Plan (IP) of certified LCP to make omnibus clarifications and clean-ups and establish permit process to permit Group Homes, Sober Living Homes, and Residential Care Facilities within Residential zoning districts citywide, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (VL-LB).
blurb.spanish: Audiencia pública y acción a petición de la Ciudad de Huntington Beach para enmendar el Plan de Implementación (IP) del LCP certificado para hacer aclaraciones y limpiezas generales y establecer un proceso de permisos para permitir viviendas grupales, hogares de vida sobria y establecimientos de cuidado residencial dentro de los distritos de zonificación residencial en toda la ciudad en Huntington Beach, condado de Orange. (VL-LB).

title.spanish: Aplicaciones de Permisos Costeros
Solicitud 5-07-370-A2 (Parques de Orange County, Newport Beach)

blurb.english: Application of Orange County Parks for after-the-fact approval of change in use of visitor dock to emergency dock, reconfiguration of public surface parking spaces, canoe storage area, change of hours of dinghy dock tie up from 72-hours to 6 am to 10 pm; increasing hours of public parking availability from 8 am to 5 pm to 6 am 10 pm, installation of new (not after-the-fact) wayfinding signage, two safety gates and fencing within the facility, canoe storage lockers, new ADA compliant roll-out mat on the sandy beach, and kayak storage rack on Bayside Beach are proposed in Newport Beah, Orange County  (MR-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)
blurb.spanish: Solicitud de los Parques de Orange County para una aprobación a posteriori del cambio de uso del muelle de visitantes a muelle de emergencia, reconfiguración de espacios de estacionamiento en la superficie pública, cambio de horas de amarre en el muelle de botes de 72 horas a 6 am a 10 pm; aumentando las horas de disponibilidad del estacionamiento público de 8 am - 5 pm a 6 am - 10 pm, instalación de nueva señalización de orientación (no a posteriori), dos puertas de seguridad y cercas dentro del establecimiento, casilleros de almacenamiento de canoas, nueva alfombra enrollable que cumple con ADA en la playa de arena y estantes de almacenamiento para kayaks en Bayside Beach. Esto se propone en Newport Beach, Orange County (MR-LB) (Nota: La división de cumplimiento de la Comisión ha abierto una investigación sobre las posibles violaciones a la Ley Costera asociadas con este elemento y sitio, según se explica más adelante en el informe del personal).

title.spanish: Solicitud No. 5-20-0072 (Huntington Beach Wetlands Conservancy y Plains All American Pipeline, Huntington Beach) Solicitud

blurb.english: Application of Huntington Beach Wetlands Conservancy and Plains All American Pipeline for restoration within Upper Magnolia Marsh, to include: removal of remnant 16” and 24” diameter petroleum product pipelines and associated infrastructure; 360 cu. yds. of grading to create  small tidal channel to improve tidal flushing; and coastal salt marsh planting, at 0.3 miles southeast of intersection of Newland St. and Pacific Coast Highway, Huntington Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)
blurb.spanish: Solicitud de Huntington Beach Wetlands Conservancy y Plains All American Pipeline para restauración dentro de Upper Magnolia Marsh para incluir: extracción de la tubería restante de 16” y 24” para productos de petróleo y su infraestructura asociada; 360 yd³ de regulación granulométrica para crear un pequeño canal de marea para mejorar la descarga de la marea; y plantación de marisma salina costera 0.3 millas al sureste de la intersección de Newland St. y Pacific Coast Highway, en Huntington Beach, Condado de Orange. (MV-LB)

title.english: City of Long Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-LOB-19-0167-2
title.spanish: Enmienda LCP No. LCP-5-LOB-19-0167-2 de la Ciudad de Long Beach

blurb.english: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Long Beach to amend the Implementing Ordinances (IP) portion of the certified LCP to: 1) update the definition for townhomes and eliminate zoning restrictions on side-by-side units; 2) eliminate references to commercial districts no longer in use; 3) eliminate size restrictions for single-family garages and update lot coverage and floor area calculations in single-family districts; 4) update roofing material requirements for residential districts; 5) revise screening requirements for mechanical equipment in low-density residential districts; 6) provide guidelines to determine curb cut closures and require underground utilities in new projects; 7) define the standing required and timeline for land use decision appeals; 8) update school siting requirements; and 9) eliminate zoning code restriction on maximum number of zoning regulation amendments per year. (DZ-LB)
blurb.spanish: Audiencia pública y acción a petición de la Ciudad de Long Beach para enmendar la porción de las Ordenanzas de Implementación (IP) del LCP certificado para: 1) actualizar la definición para casas adosadas y eliminar las restricciones de zonificación en las unidades adosadas; 2) eliminar referencias a los distritos comerciales que ya no estén en uso; 3) eliminar las restricciones de tamaño para los garajes unifamiliares y actualizar la cobertura de lotes y los cálculos de área del suelo en los distritos unifamiliares; 4) actualizar los requisitos de material para tejados para los distritos residenciales; 5) revisar los requisitos de evaluación del equipo mecánico en los distritos residenciales de baja densidad; 6) proporcionar lineamientos para determinar el cierre de bordillos y requerir los servicios subterráneos en proyectos nuevos; 7) definir la posición requerida y el calendario para las apelaciones a la decisión del uso de tierra; 8) actualizar los requisitos de ubicación de las escuelas; y 9) eliminar la restricción del código de zonificación sobre el número máximo de enmiendas a la regulación de zonificación al año. (DZ-LB)

title.english: City of Long Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-LOB-19-0168-3
title.spanish: Enmienda LCP No. LCP-5-LOB-19-0168-3 de la Ciudad de Long Beach

blurb.english: Public hearing and action on request by City of Long Beach to amend the Implementing Ordinances (IP) portion of the certified LCP in order to: 1) add definitions and provide regulations for currently undefined land uses; 2) modify development standards for distances between multiple structures on a single property within residential zoning districts, parking requirements for non-conforming historic landmarks, the definition of gross floor area, fence regulations, and rooftop solar collector height exceptions; and 3) update noticing requirements. (DZ-LB)
blurb.spanish: Audiencia pública y acción a petición de la Ciudad de Long Beach para enmendar la porción de las Ordenanzas de Implementación (IP) del LCP certificado para: 1) agregar definiciones y proporcionar regulaciones para los usos de tierra no definidos actualmente; 2) modificar los estándares de desarrollo para las distancias entre varias estructuras en una sola propiedad dentro de los distritos de zonificación residencial, requisitos de estacionamiento para puntos de referencia históricos no conformes, la definición de superficie bruta, regulaciones sobre vallas y excepciones a la altura del colector solar en el tejado; y 3) actualizar los requisitos de notificación. (DZ-LB)

title.english: City of Long Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-LOB-20-0169-4

blurb.english: Public hearing and action on request by City of Long Beach to amend the Implementing Ordinances (IP) portion of the certified LCP in order to clarify regulations for commercial, industrial, and temporary land uses; modify development standards for attics, rooftop canopies, and post-secondary educational uses; and add provisions to specify administrative procedures. (DZ-LB)
blurb.spanish: Audiencia pública y acción a petición de la ciudad de Long Beach para enmendar la porción de las Ordenanzas de Implementación (IP) del LCP certificado para para aclarar las regulaciones para usos de la tierra comercial, industrial y temporal; modificar los estándares de desarrollo para áticos, marquesinas en las azoteas y usos educativos postsecundarios; y agregar estipulaciones para especificar los procedimientos administrativos. PROCEDIMIENTOS DE ASAMBLEA VIRTUAL
CAMBIOS EN LA AGENDA
COMENTARIO PÚBLICO GENERAL

blurb.english: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.
blurb.spanish: Los comentarios públicos que no están relacionados con ninguno de los ítems específicamente incluidos en el orden del día serán oídos aproximadamente a las 9:00am, por no más de una hora. A discreción del Chair, se les dará a las personas que hablen hasta 2 minutos. Debido a la transición de Plataforma de asamblea virtual, la Comisión Costera en este momento no permitirá que se ceda tiempo de una persona que hable a otra. Nota: Durante el comentario del público general, usted puede hablar sobre un tema específico solamente una vez cada mes. Por favor, envíe su solicitud de orador antes de las 5:00 pm del día anterior a la audiencia para ayudar con la inscripción de la administración de reuniones. Las solicitudes de orador no se aceptarán después de las 8:30 am de cada día de la reunión. Sírvase consultar el memorandum de la Comisión Costera sobre procedimientos para la asamblea virtual para enviar una solicitud para hablar.

title.english: Call to Order and Roll Call
title.spanish: LLAMADO A ORDEN y VOTO NOMINAL
PROCEDIMIENTOS DE ASAMBLEA VIRTUAL
CUMPLIMIENTO DE LA CONDICION
Oceano Dunes CDP Review

blurb.english: Public hearing and potential action on revisions to CDP 4-82-300, as amended, regarding the allowable kinds, locations, and intensities of use and necessary coastal resource protection requirements at State Parks’ Oceano Dunes unit in the City of Grover Beach, the unincorporated community of Oceano, and unincorporated southern San Luis Obispo County. (KK-SC)
blurb.spanish: Audiencia pública y posible acción sobre las revisiones del CDP 4-82-300, según enmienda, con respecto a los tipos permitidos, ubicaciones e intensidades de uso y requisitos necesarios de protección de recursos costeros en la unidad Oceano Dunes de State Parks en la ciudad de Grover Beach, el comunidad no incorporada de Oceano, y el sur no incorporado del condado de San Luis Obispo. (KK-SC)

title.english: Staff report and related links above

blurb.english: When you click on the “Oceano Dunes CDP Review” link above, a new window will open up where you will see links to the Commission staff’s staff report and recommendation (“Report”), and its exhibits (“Exhibits”), as well Commissioner ex parte communication disclosures (“Ex Parte”), correspondence related to this item, and the special hearing procedures that will apply to the hearing.

With respect to correspondence, due to the large volume of correspondence received on this matter, the correspondence has been split into multiple groups. First, correspondence received between July 9, 2019 (i.e., when correspondence was last posted for the Commission’s July 2019 CDP review hearing) and February 16, 2021 (i.e., when the staff report for this item was published) are in chronological order by date received, with the most recent correspondence on top in package 1 (“Correspondence 1”), which then is continued in package 2 (“Correspondence 2”), and then package 3 (“Correspondence 3”), with the oldest correspondence being at the end of package 3.
Correspondence received since February 16, 2021 (when the staff report was published for this item) is in six additional correspondence packages:
- “Correspondence – State Parks” is correspondence received from State Parks on March 17, 2021
- “Correspondence – Groups” is correspondence from established groups with an interest in Oceano Dunes matters
- “Correspondence – Groups” is correspondence from established groups with an interest in Oceano Dunes matters

- “Correspondence – Individual”, “Correspondence – Individual 2”, and “Correspondence – Individual 3”  is correspondence from others that weren’t in the above two packages in chronological order with the newest in the first package

title.english: How to provide written comments for Commission consideration

blurb.english: To submit written materials to the Commission for consideration regarding this matter, please either email OceanoDunesReview@coastal.ca.gov or submit such materials by regular mail (725 Front Street, Suite 300, Santa Cruz, CA 95060) to Commission staff by 5 pm on Friday, March 12, 2021. Staff will then distribute your materials to the Commission. Any materials received after this time will not be distributed by staff to the Commission. Alternatively, you may also submit such materials directly to Commissioners (a list of Commissioners with their contact information is available from Commission staff, or at www.coastal.ca.gov/roster.html) provided such materials are submitted to all Commissioners, all alternates for Commissioners, the three non-voting members of the Commission, and Commission staff. We request you summarize the reasons for your position in no more than two or three pages, if possible.

IMPORTANT! PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS HEARING WILL TAKE PLACE AS PART OF A VIRTUAL MEETING. As a result of the COVID-19 emergency and the Governor’s Executive Orders (N-29-20 and N-33-20), this Coastal Commission meeting will occur virtually through video and teleconference. Special hearing procedures will apply to the hearing for this item, and they can be accessed by clicking the “Oceano Dunes CDP Review” link above. There you will find specific information and instructions on how to participate in the hearing. Please consult those special hearing procedures before submitting a request to speak at the hearing.

title.english: For more information consult the Commission’s Oceano Dunes webpage

blurb.english: The Commission has developed a webpage with information and materials designed to help the public better understand issues at Oceano Dunes as they relate to the hearing. It is located at http://www.coastal.ca.gov/oceano-dunes/. There you will find summary materials and an FAQ, materials associated with recent Commission Oceano Dunes reviews, materials associated with the California Department of Parks and Recreation’s proposals for Oceano Dunes, and materials associated with the March 18, 2021 hearing, including Commission staff’s staff report and recommendation and some summary materials that have been translated into Spanish.
Questions regarding this agenda item and/or this hearing should be directed to Coastal Commission staff via email at centralcoast@coastal.ca.gov or via phone at 831-427-4863.
